name: obsequiously
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is too eager to praise or obey someone: "Yes, my Lord, of course, your wish is my command", said the servant obsequiously. He was a huge fan of the singer, grinning obsequiously when in her presence.
More examplesFewer examplesYou need to stop behaving so obsequiously every time you meet someone wearing a uniform.They were so obsequiously cooperative and willing to help that I became suspicious.The hotel manager welcomed the famous guests, bowing obsequiously.
